title: How can self-enrichment lead to greater wealth and relationships through intellectual and emotional fulfillment?
first_phrase: In the final 200 words of this text, the author discusses the importance of cultivating one's intellectual tendencies and satisfying preferred elective activities. The goal is to achieve a balance between professional activity and purely satisfying intellectual pursuits, progressively freeing oneself from the former. The author warns against wasting time on insignificant reading material and recommends being informed about current events through attending conferences and reading relevant publications. By doing so, one can achieve self-enrichment and productive idea generation which can produce financial and social benefits.
content: Ideally one should be able to tread a proportionally inverse path between professional activity and elective activity, in such a manner that, as we go on with our life, we progressively free ourselves from our professional activity and we are gifted the chance of consecrating ourselves to the elective one with stronger determination. One should, of course, avoid the risk of a program which is so crammed that it leaves him no spare time to devote to some casual or fashionable forms of culture we should always take care to be at least informed about: Reading newspapers or magazines, attending conferences, and so on. In short, what we propose to do for our own culture is the opposite of what is generally done at present. What is harmful is to waste time reading too many newspapers and magazines of no significance, tasteless novels, vulgar works, and, worse than all of them, the vice of browsing here and there at the first printed words which fall into our hands, or of losing ourselves in the news by watching over and over again the same information we have already become conversant with.
last_phrase: In conclusion, by balancing our professional and elective activities, and focusing on meaningful forms of culture and relationships, we can find greater fulfillment in our lives. By prioritizing our personal passions, we can create an "ideal frame" for ourselves that allows us to explore our unique individuality and build deeper connections with the world around us.
